# Daily Agent Audit Report
**Date:** 2026-02-08
**Generated by:** Master Agent — Orchestrator
**Audit Type:** INITIAL FULL AUDIT (First Run)

---

## Executive Summary

This is the first comprehensive audit of John's Cowork agent ecosystem. The scan discovered **11 agents** (10 working agents + Master Agent) spanning music production, content creation, web development, and catalog management. The ecosystem is ambitious and well-conceived, but **6 of 11 agents lack a RULES.md file**, which means Claude is guessing at their purpose when opened. The strongest agents (Ridgemont Catalog Manager, Suno Prompt Generator, X-Posts) share a common trait: detailed, opinionated rules files. The weakest agents are essentially code repositories masquerading as Cowork agents. Three merge opportunities and one split opportunity would immediately improve the ecosystem.

## Overall Ecosystem Score: 6.6/10

---

## Agent-by-Agent Status

### Agent: Frozen Cloud Website
- **Folder:** `Frozen Cloud Website/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 5.2/10
  - Clarity: 2/10 — No RULES.md, no instructions of any kind. Claude has zero guidance when this folder is opened.
  - Scope: 8/10 — Single clear purpose: a landing page for the Frozen Cloud artist.
  - Data Quality: 6/10 — Clean HTML + one image. Functional but minimal.
  - Utilization: 3/10 — Static website, likely set-and-forget. Last modified Jan 26.
  - Effectiveness: 7/10 — The website itself is professional with glassmorphism design, responsive layout, and proper branding.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - No RULES.md — Claude cannot assist effectively without knowing what it should do here.
  - No .gitignore beyond basics. No deployment pipeline documented.
  - Streaming links in HTML point to placeholder URLs.
- **Recommendations:**
  - Add a RULES.md defining: what kind of updates John might request, deployment process, and relationship to ridgemontstudio.com.
  - Consider whether this belongs in Cowork at all — it may be better as a standalone GitHub repo that Ridgemont Studio Website links to.

---

### Agent: Make Videos
- **Folder:** `Make Videos/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 6.6/10
  - Clarity: 8/10 — Excellent GAME_PLAN.md (215 lines) with 5 workflow phases, monetization targets, and success metrics. Two well-defined skills (yt-daily, x-content).
  - Scope: 4/10 — This is trying to be 4 agents in one: YouTube scripting, X content generation, GitHub Pages recording aids, AND Remotion video rendering. Each is a distinct workflow.
  - Data Quality: 7/10 — Well-organized with date-stamped content. Feb 5 episode fully produced. Some empty directories (Video_Scripts, Thumbnails).
  - Utilization: 7/10 — Actively producing daily content. Last content: Feb 5.
  - Effectiveness: 7/10 — Produces complete content packages with scripts, speaker notes, X posts, and recording aids.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - **CRITICAL OVERLAP:** The `x-content` skill in Make Videos generates X crypto posts — this is exactly what the X-Posts agent does. Two agents are producing the same type of content.
  - `my-video/node_modules/` is 501 MB of disk space. Not appropriate for a Google Drive-synced folder.
  - Humanization settings (typo injection, timing randomization) may create compliance risks on X if the account scales.
  - 4+ distinct workflows bloat context when the agent is loaded.
- **Recommendations:**
  - **SPLIT:** Move Remotion video project (`my-video/`) out of Cowork entirely — it's a build tool, not a Cowork agent.
  - **RESOLVE OVERLAP:** Consolidate all X content generation into X-Posts agent. Remove the `x-content` skill from Make Videos.
  - **SPLIT (optional):** Consider separating YouTube Cardano Daily vs. YouTube Blockchain Basics into distinct subfolders with their own workflows if both channels are active.

---

### Agent: Make-Music
- **Folder:** `Make-Music/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 5.6/10
  - Clarity: 3/10 — No RULES.md. No instructions for Claude. The folder is a raw workspace.
  - Scope: 7/10 — Focused on songwriting and MIDI composition. Clear purpose.
  - Data Quality: 6/10 — 3 complete song projects (Trouble, Getting Old, Better Than Dreams) plus 13 orphan/test MIDI files with no naming convention.
  - Utilization: 6/10 — Active Jan 29 – Feb 3. Weekly creative work.
  - Effectiveness: 6/10 — Produces MIDI files and has a Logic Pro project, but the workflow is ad hoc.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - No RULES.md — Claude doesn't know the composition workflow or naming conventions.
  - 13 test/orphan MIDI files (chord_test.mid, chord_test_simple.mid, etc.) clutter the folder.
  - `Trouble Bad/` Logic Pro project has 885KB of binary data that won't benefit from Cowork context.
  - Suno prompt files (Getting_Old_Suno.txt, Better_Than_Dreams_Suno.txt) overlap with Suno Prompt Generator's domain.
- **Recommendations:**
  - Create a RULES.md defining: songwriting workflow, file naming convention (e.g., `[Song]_[BPM]_[Version].mid`), and folder structure (Songs/, Tests/, Suno/).
  - Clean up test MIDI files into a `Tests/` subfolder.
  - Move Suno prompt files to reference the Suno Prompt Generator agent, or define which agent owns Suno prompt authoring.

---

### Agent: Ridgemont Catalog Manager
- **Folder:** `Ridgemont Catalog Manager/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 8.6/10
  - Clarity: 9/10 — Exceptional. Five versioned system prompts, detailed spec document, implementation reports for every phase, and shortcode command system.
  - Scope: 8/10 — Focused on catalog management with well-bounded extensions (sync, revenue, pitching).
  - Data Quality: 9/10 — 98+ songs with complete metadata, automated 10-backup rotation, structured JSON schema, writer registry, album tracking.
  - Utilization: 8/10 — Central to the music business workflow. Data feeds two portal agents.
  - Effectiveness: 9/10 — Full-featured production system with shortcodes, Streamlit dashboard, pitch generation, and revenue tracking.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - `.env` file contains Cloudflare R2 credentials (account ID, access keys). Verify this is in `.gitignore`.
  - `supervisors.json` is nearly empty (23 bytes) — pitch generation depends on this but there's no supervisor data.
  - Catalog shows 98+ songs but revenue is $0.00 across all songs — tracking may not be active.
- **Recommendations:**
  - Populate `supervisors.json` with actual music supervisor contacts to make pitch generation functional.
  - Begin tracking real revenue data to make the financial dashboard meaningful.
  - This agent should be the model for all others — its documentation approach should be replicated.

---

### Agent: Ridgemont Studio Website
- **Folder:** `Ridgemont Studio Website/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 5.0/10
  - Clarity: 3/10 — No RULES.md. No documentation beyond inline code comments.
  - Scope: 7/10 — Clear single purpose: the label website.
  - Data Quality: 5/10 — `tracks.json` is empty (0 bytes). `test-track.mp3` is a 48KB mono test file. Empty `Ridgemont Catalog Manager/` subdirectory.
  - Utilization: 4/10 — Deployed (has CNAME for ridgemontstudio.com) but appears static since initial setup.
  - Effectiveness: 6/10 — Working website with Firebase auth and Cloudflare streaming, but data layer is unpopulated.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - No RULES.md — Claude doesn't know how to help maintain this site.
  - `tracks.json` is empty — the music streaming feature has no content.
  - Empty `Ridgemont Catalog Manager/` subdirectory is confusing.
  - Artist roster (8 artists in HTML) appears to be placeholder data.
  - `node_modules/` in a Google Drive folder.
- **Recommendations:**
  - Create a RULES.md covering: deployment workflow, how to sync tracks from Catalog Manager, and artist roster management.
  - Remove the empty `Ridgemont Catalog Manager/` subfolder.
  - Populate `tracks.json` by running `sync-music.sh` with real catalog data.
  - Consider linking the streaming backend to the Ridgemont Catalog Manager's data so artist portal shows real songs.

---

### Agent: Suno Prompt Generator
- **Folder:** `Suno Prompt Generator/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 8.6/10
  - Clarity: 9/10 — Detailed CLAUDE_INSTRUCTIONS.md with decision workflow, token hierarchy, user-approved overrides, and slider recommendations. Comprehensive suno_v5_rules.md reference.
  - Scope: 9/10 — Tightly focused on one thing: generating Suno prompts deterministically.
  - Data Quality: 9/10 — 122 subgenres, 1228 tags, 1223 instruments, 9 presets, schema validation script, migration documentation.
  - Utilization: 7/10 — Used for music production. Last modified Jan 25.
  - Effectiveness: 9/10 — Deterministic, reproducible, seed-based outputs with CLI and Cowork interfaces.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - `SKILL.md` exists but may not be registered in `.skills/` directory for auto-triggering.
  - `groove_enhancements.json` staging area may have unmerged entries.
  - No automated tests beyond `validate_schema.py`.
- **Recommendations:**
  - **MERGE with Suno Trainer:** Move training/reference material into a `references/` or `training/` subfolder within Suno Prompt Generator. The merged agent becomes the single source of truth for all Suno-related work.
  - Verify the SKILL.md is properly registered for auto-triggering in Cowork.
  - Run `merge_groove_enhancements.py` if staging data exists.

### Agent: Suno Trainer
- **Folder:** `Suno Trainer/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 6.0/10
  - Clarity: 6/10 — Well-written reference documents but no RULES.md telling Claude how to use them.
  - Scope: 7/10 — Focused on Suno training and library management.
  - Data Quality: 7/10 — Comprehensive 17KB tips guide and library assessment. The .docx syllabus is harder to use in Cowork.
  - Utilization: 4/10 — Reference material consulted occasionally. Not a daily driver.
  - Effectiveness: 6/10 — Good content but no active workflow automation.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - No RULES.md — Claude doesn't know it should reference these docs during music creation.
  - The .docx syllabus is a binary format that Claude can't easily search or reference inline.
  - Library Organization Assessment references 160 songs and 17 workspaces in Suno — this data isn't connected to the Catalog Manager.
  - Only 3 files total — this is thin for a standalone agent.
- **Recommendations:**
  - **MERGE into Suno Prompt Generator.** Move all three files into a `training/` subfolder. The merged agent becomes "Suno" or "Suno Studio" — handling both generation and training.
  - Convert the .docx syllabus to .md for easier Claude access.
  - Link the library organization recommendations to the Catalog Manager's song data.

### Agent: X-Posts
- **Folder:** `X-Posts/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 8.2/10
  - Clarity: 9/10 — Detailed 13-step daily workflow, explicit style rules (lowercase, no apostrophes, deadpan), phrase tracking, and LEARNING phase designation.
  - Scope: 7/10 — Focused on X posting but also manages image generation, character assets (Weeter & Blubby), and API integration.
  - Data Quality: 8/10 — Post history tracked with dates, top posts analyzed, 9 scheduled posts ready, phrases-to-avoid list maintained.
  - Utilization: 9/10 — Most active agent. Last modified Feb 8 (today). Daily use with 267+ posts generated.
  - Effectiveness: 8/10 — Produces ready-to-post content with human approval loop. Voice learning is active.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - `claude_desktop_config.json` contains X API credentials (API key, secret, access tokens) in plaintext.
  - `CLAUDE.md` contains universal rules meant for ALL agents but lives only in X-Posts folder.
  - Character asset PNGs total ~44 MB — heavy for a Google Drive-synced Cowork folder.
  - **OVERLAP:** Both X-Posts and Make Videos generate X crypto content.
- **Recommendations:**
  - Move `CLAUDE.md` universal rules to the Cowork root directory or `.skills/` so all agents inherit them.
  - Move API credentials out of the folder — use environment variables instead.
  - Establish X-Posts as the SOLE owner of X content generation. Remove the x-content skill from Make Videos.
  - Consider moving Weeter & Blubby assets to a shared `assets/` folder if other agents need them.

### Agent: frozen-cloud-portal
- **Folder:** `frozen-cloud-portal/`
- **Status:** new
- **Health Score:** 6.0/10
  - Clarity: 3/10 — No RULES.md. Purpose only discoverable by reading the code.
  - Scope: 8/10 — Single, clear purpose: read-only catalog portal for Frozen Cloud.
  - Data Quality: 7/10 — Shared catalog.json with 142 Frozen Cloud songs. But has duplicate app.py files (root and scripts/).
  - Utilization: 5/10 — Read-only browsing portal. Occasional use.
  - Effectiveness: 7/10 — Works as intended when Streamlit is running.
- **Files Changed Since Last Audit:** First audit — no baseline.
- **Issues Detected:**
  - No RULES.md.
  - Duplicate `app.py` — one in root and one in `scripts/`. Which is authoritative?
  - `venv/` is 347 MB in a Google Drive folder.
  - `data/catalog.json` (258KB) is a full copy of the master catalog, not a symlink or filtered extract.
- **Recommendations:**
  - **MERGE with park-bellevue-portal** into a single "Catalog Portals" or "Act Portals" agent with an act selector dropdown. The codebases are nearly identical.
  - Remove the duplicate `app.py` — keep one authoritative version.
  - Move `venv/` to `.gitignore` — virtual environments shouldn't sync to Google Drive.

  - `Untitled.txt` is an empty file (0 bytes).
  - Duplicate `app.py` files.
  - Full 258KB `catalog.json` copy when only 6 songs are relevant.
- **Recommendations:**
  - **MERGE with frozen-cloud-portal** immediately. A single multi-act portal with a dropdown selector would serve both acts better.
  - Delete `Untitled.txt`.
  - Consider whether a dedicated portal is justified until the Park Bellevue catalog grows beyond 20+ songs.

  - Set up API key and test the daily automation pipeline.

## Change Summary

| Agent | File | Change Type | Details |
|-------|------|-------------|---------|
| All agents | (entire ecosystem) | NEW_AGENT | First audit — all 11 agents discovered and registered |

---

## New Agents Discovered

All 11 agents are newly discovered in this initial audit. The ecosystem breaks down into four functional clusters:

1. **Music Production Cluster:** Make-Music, Suno Prompt Generator, Suno Trainer, Ridgemont Catalog Manager
2. **Content Creation Cluster:** Make Videos, X-Posts
3. **Web Properties Cluster:** Frozen Cloud Website, Ridgemont Studio Website, frozen-cloud-portal, park-bellevue-portal
4. **Orchestration:** Master Agent

---

## Cross-Agent Analysis

### Overlap Detection

1. **X-Posts vs. Make Videos (x-content skill)** — CRITICAL. Both agents generate X/Twitter crypto content. Make Videos has a dedicated `x-content` skill (167 lines) that produces clip scripts, text posts, daily threads, and engagement content. X-Posts does the exact same thing with its own 13-step workflow. These must be consolidated.

2. **frozen-cloud-portal vs. park-bellevue-portal** — HIGH. Nearly identical Streamlit codebases (same requirements.txt, same app structure, same catalog.json data source). The only difference is the `act_id` filter string.

3. **Suno Prompt Generator vs. Suno Trainer** — MODERATE. Both serve the Suno AI music domain. The Trainer has reference material that the Generator's CLAUDE_INSTRUCTIONS.md could reference.

4. **Make-Music Suno prompts vs. Suno Prompt Generator** — LOW. Make-Music contains Suno prompt text files (Getting_Old_Suno.txt, Better_Than_Dreams_Suno.txt) that were likely generated manually rather than through the Suno Prompt Generator.

5. **Ridgemont Studio Website vs. Ridgemont Catalog Manager** — LOW. The website has an empty `Ridgemont Catalog Manager/` subdirectory and references R2 storage, suggesting an incomplete integration.

### Gap Detection

1. **No Bajan Sun portal** — The Catalog Manager tracks 3 acts (Frozen Cloud, Park Bellevue, Bajan Sun), but there's no Bajan Sun portal. Further evidence that a single multi-act portal is the right design.

2. **No distribution/upload automation** — The GAME_PLAN.md in Make Videos references `/upload-all` and `/shorts` skills that don't exist yet.

3. **No Instagram or TikTok agent** — Make Videos references these platforms but has no dedicated workflow for them.

4. **No financial/accounting agent** — Revenue tracking exists in the Catalog Manager but isn't connected to actual streaming platform data.

5. **Universal rules (CLAUDE.md) only in X-Posts** — This file defines browser rules, MCP preferences, and agent phase that should apply to ALL agents but lives in only one folder.

### Merge Candidates

| Pair | Merge Score | Recommendation |
|------|-------------|----------------|
| frozen-cloud-portal + park-bellevue-portal | 9.2/10 | **MERGE IMMEDIATELY.** Create single "Act Portals" agent with act selector. Nearly identical code, same data source. |
| Suno Prompt Generator + Suno Trainer | 7.5/10 | **MERGE RECOMMENDED.** Move training docs into Generator as `training/` subfolder. One agent for all Suno work. |
| X-Posts absorbs Make Videos x-content | 7.8/10 | **CONSOLIDATE.** X-Posts owns all X content. Remove x-content skill from Make Videos entirely. |

### Split Candidates

| Agent | Split Score | Recommendation |
|-------|-------------|----------------|
| Make Videos | 8.1/10 | **SPLIT RECOMMENDED.** Remove Remotion project entirely (it's a build tool, not a Cowork agent). Separate YouTube scripting from the remaining workflows. Post-split, this agent becomes "YouTube Content" focused on script generation and recording aids only. |

---

## Priority Recommendations

1. **HIGH: Resolve X-Posts vs. Make Videos overlap.** Two agents generating competing X content creates confusion and risks conflicting voice/style. Designate X-Posts as the sole owner of X content. Remove the x-content skill and humanization_settings.md from Make Videos.

2. **HIGH: Merge frozen-cloud-portal + park-bellevue-portal.** These are the same app with a different filter string. Create a single "Catalog Portal" agent with an act selector dropdown. This also prepares for the Bajan Sun act.

3. **HIGH: Add RULES.md to the 6 agents that lack one.** Without rules, Claude is guessing. Priority order: Make-Music (active creative workflow), Ridgemont Studio Website (deployed production site), frozen-cloud-portal (read-only but still needs context), Frozen Cloud Website, Suno Trainer (merge first), park-bellevue-portal (merge first).

4. **MEDIUM: Merge Suno Prompt Generator + Suno Trainer.** The training material complements the generator. Combined agent becomes the definitive Suno resource.

5. **MEDIUM: Move CLAUDE.md universal rules to Cowork root.** Currently only X-Posts gets browser rules, MCP preferences, and agent phase. All agents should inherit these.

6. **MEDIUM: Split Make Videos.** Remove the 501 MB Remotion project. Remove X content (moved to X-Posts). What remains is a focused "YouTube Content" agent for script generation and recording aids.

7. **LOW: Clean up disk-heavy folders.** `node_modules/` (501 MB in Make Videos) and `venv/` (347 MB in frozen-cloud-portal, similar in park-bellevue-portal) shouldn't live in Google Drive-synced Cowork folders. Add to `.gitignore` or move to local-only paths.

8. **LOW: Reorganize Master Agent folder structure.** Move data files into `data/` and scripts into `scripts/` to match the documented structure in RULES.md.

---

## Action Items

- [ ] Designate X-Posts as sole X content owner; remove x-content skill from Make Videos
- [ ] Merge frozen-cloud-portal + park-bellevue-portal into single multi-act portal
- [ ] Create RULES.md for Make-Music with composition workflow and naming conventions
- [ ] Create RULES.md for Ridgemont Studio Website with deployment and sync instructions
- [ ] Merge Suno Trainer into Suno Prompt Generator as training/ subfolder
- [ ] Move CLAUDE.md from X-Posts to Cowork root directory
- [ ] Remove my-video/ Remotion project from Make Videos (move to local dev environment)
- [ ] Remove node_modules/ and venv/ from Google Drive-synced agent folders
- [ ] Populate supervisors.json in Ridgemont Catalog Manager with real contacts
- [ ] Reorganize Master Agent file structure to match RULES.md specification
- [ ] Configure daily_monitor.py with API key and test automation pipeline
- [ ] Delete empty Untitled.txt from park-bellevue-portal
